divs: sighting detailsi've had two sightings -- it was the summer 1977 - i was in the 6th grade at the time and living in colorado springs. it was a beautiful day and i was out collecting pop bottles when for no reason i looked up. and about 1\2 mile up, i noticed there were (3) of them and looked like two nickels stacked on top of one another spinning with a red static glow around it., two were stationary and the other was moving around, like it was trying to position itself as if it was looking at something. moments later, all three objects shot straight up higher from my view - about another mile and hovered there for about 20-30 minutes. i just stood there mesmerized by it. then i started having this sinking fear feeling. then a man came up to me and asked me what i was looking at - i looked at him for just a moment and when i looked back up, the objects were even further up, then they suddenly vanished - like as if you turned off a light...blink, they were gone. i never saw them again until i saw a show about the ufos that appeared over mexico city during an eclipse - i believe it was in 1993. they looked just like what i saw in '77 -- 16 years earlier. it just blew me away! it was really cool seeing them again -- and caught on film. that same summer, my class had an encounter with something while we were all at camp at camp shady brook. (i dont remember where that place is - somewhere west of the springs in the mountains) one night (around 11pm) there was a scientist there with a telescope and we were all looking at the rings of saturn, and it was my understanding from mrs, hall (my teacher) that this guy was from norad - and he was there to teach us some astronomy. when it was my turn to look at saturn, i noticed a light (fuzzy glow) off in the distance that was coming towards us and seemed very low -- no more than 50ft above the tops of the trees. it was moving very slow, and had no sound. i asked mrs, hall - "what is that?" she said it was a plane. i thought to myself that it was flying way too low to be a plane. as it got right on us (about 100 yards away) it stopped, and so did we -- it got very quite, even the crickets stopped chirping. then the object suddenly made a 90������ turn and started going east. it was moving very slow (no sound) it looked like a fuzzy tennis ball - with a soft white glow with no details to it. moments later it started to move upwards at a 45������ angle. the it started speeding up, and then it took off like 300 miles an hour, then even faster like a shooting star at that same 45������ angle -- straight back up into the atmosphere. i turned around to asked that guy (from norad) -- what just happened, what was that??? he was gone! he had raced down the hill back to his car and drove off -- leaving his telescope behind. the weird part about all of this -- no one thought that anything unusual had just happened - of course, we were all only 6th graders.... what do we know. but i was very observant of the event. when we got back to the city - i couldn't understand why no one wanted to talk about it. i was bugging mrs, hall about it - so being the artist that i am, she told me to draw a picture of it -- so i did... i made a very detailed storyboard. the next day, some man showed up and asked me if he could have the drawing.... so i gave it to him. he explained to me that it was a helicopter, and that was the end of that. mmmmm -- that was a very quite helicopter! the man took my drawing and left. mrs. hall told me to never talk about it again or i would be disciplined. so, i never gave it much thought after that - plus, as a 6th grader, i got distracted and moved on to something else anyway. but i never forgot about it, and its something i still think about to this day. i dont know why i feel compelled to talk about this now -- maybe because i think about it so much, i just have to share it and maybe someone else out there can relate.
